WorkItem.Description: Using the Rawr addon to export my character, on import to Rawr my spec was completely wrong, missing some points and having points allocated. Below is the export from the addon and attached is the character that is created.

Comments.Message: I forgot to mention, Rawr 4.0.19.0b, addon version 0.63.
Moved import text to attached file "Rhandric@US-Azuremyst.xml"
I believe this issue may be due to something broken in wow, not us. There's ghost talents in the Mage trees. Or did that get fixed already?

I wrote a work around in the addon for the broken Blizzard code. It may be they fixed it in 4.0.6 and thus the workaround should be removed. A mage is the one class I don't have if someone could test this please?

Alternatively they might not have fixed it yet and the workaround in the addon which checks for client being 4.0.3 will not work when client is 4.0.6.

Check - login to Mage type /run Rawr:DebugTalents()

check the output the rogue talent was in tree 1 talent 15 if its not fixed the talent name will be "not specified". If this is STILL the case the addon fix is to change the 4.0.3 to 4.0.6 in export.lua line 305.
I've posted a fix with 4.0.6 client but this needs checking as described.
Levva: I don't know whether the version of the Rawr addon matters for that command, when I run it I see tab: 1 talent: 15: not specified, using 0.63.
Then v0.64 will fix it - its uploaded to Curse just awaiting approval.
